intro: Epilobium luteum, commonly known as yellow willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist habitats such as meadows, riverbanks, and wetlands. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in terminal spikes. Epilobium luteum is often used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory properties.
